text:
Task "VssCheckOut" (and maybe other VSS tasks too) does not use "recursive" 
attribute. I check command line created by this tasks and there is no "-R" 
switch.
creator: primoz.prislan@marand.si

text: *** Bug 13591 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: sbailliez@apache.org
bodewig@apache.org
text:
I must be missing something here (I don't have vss installed, but we can look 
at the command line.

<project default="vss">
  <target name="vss">
    <vsscheckout vsspath="foo" recursive="${recursive}"/>
  </target>
</project>

> ant -f /tmp/vss.xml -Drecursive=true -debug

after a lot of stuff:

vss:
Execute:Java13CommandLauncher: Executing 'ss' with arguments:
'Checkout'
'$foo'
'-I-'
'-R'

The ' characters around the executable and arguments are
not part of the command.

> ant -f /tmp/vss.xml -Drecursive=false -debug

vss:
Execute:Java13CommandLauncher: Executing 'ss' with arguments:
'Checkout'
'$foo'
'-I-'

The ' characters around the executable and arguments are
not part of the command.

So there is a -R if recursive is set to true, but none if it is false.

Sounds as if the task was correct.

creator: jesse@cryptocard.com
text:
The recursive option '-R' is added when the recursive attribute is set.

Tested with <vsscheckout> and <vssget> using Ant 1.5.1 and 1.6

Jesse
